tool.name: OTB.ManageNoData
tool.command: $__tool_directory__/Code/openapi.py isArrayin False isArraymode.apply.mask False output_data_out $output_data_out name OTB.ManageNoData in $in out $out usenan $usenan mode $mode mode.buildmask.inv $mode.buildmask.inv mode.buildmask.outv $mode.buildmask.outv mode.changevalue.newv $mode.changevalue.newv mode.apply.mask $mode.apply.mask mode.apply.ndval $mode.apply.ndval ram $ram prefer $prefer response $response outputType_out $OutputSection_out.outputType_out transmissionMode_out $OutputSection_out.transmissionMode_out

param.name: in
param.label: Input image
param.help: Input image The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, png, tiff

param.name: usenan
param.label: If active, the application will consider NaN as no-data values as well
param.help: If active, the application will consider NaN as no-data values as well

param.name: mode
param.label: Allows choosing between different no-data handling options
param.help: Allows choosing between different no-data handling options

param.name: mode.buildmask.inv
param.label: Value given in the output mask to pixels that are not no data pixels
param.help: Value given in the output mask to pixels that are not no data pixels

param.name: mode.buildmask.outv
param.label: Value given in the output mask to pixels that are no data pixels
param.help: Value given in the output mask to pixels that are no data pixels

param.name: mode.apply.mask
param.label: Mask to be applied on input image (valid pixels have non null values)
param.help: Mask to be applied on input image (valid pixels have non null values) The following data types are allowed in the txt file: jpeg, png, tiff

param.name: mode.apply.ndval
param.label: No Data value used according to the mask image
param.help: No Data value used according to the mask image

param.name: response
param.label: Response Type
param.help: Choose 'raw' for raw data or 'document' for document data.

section.name: OutputSection_out
section.title: Select the appropriate transmission mode for the output format

tool.help: This application has two modes. The first allows building a mask of no-data pixels from the no-data flags read from the image file. The second allows updating the change the no-data value of an image (pixels value and metadata). This last mode also allows replacing NaN in images with a proper no-data value. To do so, one should activate the NaN is no-data option.
